newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Circuit City started as hold.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Circuit City started as hold.

text.p: -- Dain Bosworth Inc said Friday it introduced coverage of Cirrcuit City Stores Inc with a hold rating and earnings estimates of $1.45 per share in fiscal 1997 and $1.83 per share in 1998.
-- Dain analyst Dean Ramos said the company is "arguably the best-positioned of the leading consumer electronics retailers with expansion potential."
Circuit City has the potential to reach 800 locations by fiscal 2000, up from the current 481 stores, Ramos said.

-- Ramos cautioned that the company's CarMax division, its used-car superstore concept, is expected to negatively impact Circuit City's earnings until fiscal 1999. He added that Circuit City plans to complete a transaction in January that will create a tracking stock for CarMax.
-- Circuit City operates a chain of computer and consumer electronics stores.
-- Its stock closed down 1/8 Friday at 29-3/8.
